definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: Another statue, right at the bottom of the famous Heidelberg Schloss .
sentences.chinese: 另一个雕塑，座落在海德堡有名的城堡下方。

sentences.english: Neanderthal features began to emerge from Homo heidelbergensis just before 500, 000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 海德堡人开始演化出尼安德特人刚好是在50万年前。

sentences.english: New four-colour printing press outside of Heidelberg, CTP technology.
sentences.chinese: 全新对开海德堡四色印刷机，CTP技术。

sentences.english: In 1997, he held the "Charm of the Orient" personal art show in Heidelberg, Germany.
sentences.chinese: 1997年在德国海德堡举办“东方之韵”个人展。

sentences.english: One of a church clock tower in Heidelberg.

sentences.chinese: 教堂在海德堡是最常见的。

definition: München or Munich, capital of Bavaria, Germany
Mannheim, German city at the confluence of Rhine and Neckar
Dresden, capital of Saxony 薩克森州|萨克森州[Sa4 ke4 sen1 zhou1], Germany
Nürnberg or Nuremberg, town in Bavaria, Germany

pinyin: Bu4 la1 di2 si1 la1 fa1
